intro: Meriania mutabilis, commonly known as the variable meriania, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, with a glossy surface and a broad, ovate shape. The flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and can change color as they mature, contributing to its common name.
